Basic details: Robert Smith, a 69-year-old male, comes to the ED complaining of left arm pain.
Vitals:
BP: 150/90 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 20/minute
HR: 85/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting on the examination bed, holding his left arm with a pained expression.
Occasionally rubbing his left shoulder.
Exhibiting mild shortness of breath when asked to take a deep breath.
If the examinee mentions a possible stroke, ask, 'What do you mean by stroke?'
Challenging question: 'Could this be a sign of a serious condition? What should I do next?'
